questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to run code without provisioning or managing servers?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda allows you to run code in response to events without managing servers. It automatically scales and charges only for compute time consumed. EC2 requires managing servers, Fargate runs containers without servers, and ECS orchestrates containers but doesn’t directly execute code functions.

questions.question: Which AWS support plan provides access to 24x7 cloud support engineers via phone, chat, and email?
questions.explanation: The AWS Business Support plan offers 24x7 access to AWS Cloud Support Engineers via phone, chat, and email. Basic Support only includes customer service and documentation, Developer Support offers limited business-hour access, and Enterprise adds a Technical Account Manager (TAM).

questions.question: Which AWS service enables you to manage multiple AWS accounts under a single organization?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows centralized management of multiple AWS accounts. It enables consolidated billing, policy enforcement, and account creation. Control Tower builds on Organizations for governance setup, IAM manages user permissions, and Directory Service connects AWS with on-premises directories.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Amazon CloudFront?

options.text: To accelerate content delivery to global users using edge locations
To manage network traffic between AWS accounts
To provide virtual private networks (VPNs) for secure communication
To store and retrieve data in S3 buckets

questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a Content Delivery Network (CDN) that caches and delivers content to users globally via edge locations, reducing latency. It doesn’t store data (S3 does), nor manage traffic (Route 53, VPC), nor provide VPNs (AWS VPN).

questions.question: Which AWS service is used to create isolated networks within AWS?
questions.explanation: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) enables you to create isolated, customizable networks within AWS. It lets you define subnets, route tables, and security groups. Route 53 manages DNS, Direct Connect establishes private links, and Transit Gateway connects multiple VPCs.

questions.question: Which AWS service is used to store and retrieve any amount of data at any time?
questions.explanation: Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) provides object storage for any amount of data. It offers high durability (11 nines) and global accessibility. EBS provides block storage for EC2, EFS is for shared file storage, and Storage Gateway integrates on-premises and cloud storage.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a fully managed relational database solution?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS (Relational Database Service) is a managed service for relational databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL, and Oracle. It automates backups and scaling. Aurora is a high-performance RDS engine, DynamoDB is NoSQL, and Redshift is for data warehousing.

questions.question: Which AWS service is used for monitoring metrics and setting alarms for AWS resources?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudWatch collects metrics, logs, and events from AWS resources. It allows setting alarms and automating responses to performance changes. CloudTrail tracks API calls, Config records configurations, and Trusted Advisor gives best-practice recommendations.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to transfer large amounts of data into and out of AWS using physical devices?
questions.explanation: AWS Snowball enables secure physical transfer of large amounts of data to and from AWS using rugged devices. DataSync automates online transfers, Storage Gateway connects on-premises storage, and S3 Transfer Acceleration speeds up uploads via optimized endpoints.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides managed message queuing between distributed application components?
questions.explanation: Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS) provides fully managed message queues for decoupling distributed applications. It ensures reliable, scalable communication between components. SNS delivers notifications to subscribers, MQ is for legacy protocols, and EventBridge routes events.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to automatically distribute incoming application traffic across multiple targets?
questions.explanation: Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) automatically distributes incoming traffic across multiple EC2 instances, containers, or IP addresses in one or more Availability Zones, improving fault tolerance. Route 53 handles DNS, CloudFront caches content, and Global Accelerator optimizes routing but not load balancing.

questions.question: Which AWS service is designed for real-time data streaming and analytics?
questions.explanation: Amazon Kinesis allows you to collect, process, and analyze real-time streaming data such as logs, IoT telemetry, and social media feeds. Athena performs ad-hoc queries, EMR processes large datasets using Hadoop, and Glue manages ETL workflows.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps developers deploy and manage applications without dealing with the underlying infrastructure?
questions.explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk allows developers to deploy web applications quickly without managing the infrastructure. It handles provisioning, scaling, and monitoring automatically. CloudFormation provisions infrastructure as code, OpsWorks manages configurations, and EC2 requires manual setup.

questions.question: Which AWS service is used to automate resource provisioning using templates?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudFormation allows you to define AWS infrastructure as code using JSON or YAML templates. It automates provisioning and ensures consistent deployments. OpsWorks manages configurations, CodeDeploy automates deployments, and Systems Manager oversees operations.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps you detect and investigate potential security threats in your AWS environment?
questions.explanation: Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously monitors for malicious activity and unauthorized behavior. Shield provides DDoS protection, Inspector scans for vulnerabilities, and WAF filters web traffic.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to create and manage encryption keys for your applications and data?
questions.explanation: AWS Key Management Service (KMS) lets you create and control cryptographic keys used to encrypt data. Secrets Manager securely stores credentials, Certificate Manager manages SSL/TLS certificates, and Cognito handles authentication for web and mobile apps.

questions.question: Which AWS service is used to provide DNS in the cloud?
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a scalable and highly available Domain Name System (DNS) web service that translates domain names into IP addresses. CloudFront is a CDN, Direct Connect provides private connectivity, and Global Accelerator optimizes routing for applications.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides recommendations to help optimize your AWS environment for performance and cost?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor inspects your AWS environment and provides recommendations across cost optimization, performance, security, and fault tolerance. Config records configuration changes, CloudTrail logs API activity, and CloudWatch monitors metrics.

questions.question: Which AWS service can you use to store structured or semi-structured data and perform SQL queries directly on it?
questions.explanation: Amazon Athena allows you to query structured or semi-structured data stored in Amazon S3 using standard SQL, without the need to load it into a database. EMR is for big data processing, Glue performs ETL tasks, and S3 is the storage layer.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a fully managed NoSQL database solution?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database that provides single-digit millisecond performance at any scale. RDS and Aurora are relational databases, while Redshift is a data warehouse service for analytical queries.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to analyze and process large datasets using open-source frameworks such as Hadoop and Spark?
questions.explanation: Amazon Elastic MapReduce (EMR) provides a managed Hadoop and Spark framework for analyzing and processing massive amounts of data quickly and cost-effectively. Athena is serverless query analysis, Glue is ETL, and Redshift is a data warehouse service.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides centralized access control and permissions management across AWS resources?
questions.explanation: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) enables you to securely control access to AWS resources through users, groups, and roles. Single Sign-On (SSO) provides centralized access to multiple accounts, Directory Service connects to on-premises AD, and Secrets Manager stores credentials.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to automatically scale EC2 instances based on demand?
questions.explanation: AWS Auto Scaling automatically adjusts the number of EC2 instances (or other resources) in response to demand, ensuring consistent performance and optimized cost. CloudWatch triggers alarms, ELB distributes traffic, and CloudFormation provisions infrastructure.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a virtual firewall for controlling inbound and outbound traffic to AWS resources?
questions.explanation: Security Groups act as virtual firewalls for EC2 instances, controlling inbound and outbound traffic. AWS WAF filters web traffic at the application layer, Shield provides DDoS protection, and Config monitors configuration compliance.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to run containerized applications without managing the underlying servers?
questions.explanation: Amazon ECS with AWS Fargate enables you to run containers without provisioning or managing servers. EC2 requires manual server management, EKS with EC2 uses Kubernetes but still requires node management, and Lambda runs code but not full containers.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps protect your web applications from common web exploits and attacks?
questions.explanation: AWS Web Application Firewall (WAF) protects web applications by filtering HTTP and HTTPS requests based on customizable rules. Shield mitigates DDoS attacks, Inspector performs vulnerability assessments, and Config tracks configuration changes.

questions.question: Which AWS service can you use to host a serverless REST API?
questions.explanation: Amazon API Gateway enables you to create, publish, and manage RESTful APIs at scale, often paired with AWS Lambda for a fully serverless architecture. EC2 and RDS require server management, while CloudFormation provisions resources.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to query and analyze log data from multiple sources in near real-time?
questions.explanation: CloudWatch Logs Insights lets you query and analyze log data interactively across AWS services. CloudTrail tracks API calls, Config records configurations, and Kinesis Firehose delivers streaming data to destinations like S3 or Redshift.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to send notifications to subscribers using topics?
questions.explanation: Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) allows publishers to send messages to multiple subscribers via topics using push-based messaging. SQS is a pull-based message queue, Lambda executes code, and EventBridge routes application events.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to launch and manage virtual servers in the cloud?
questions.explanation: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) provides scalable virtual servers (instances) that you can launch, configure, and manage. Lambda runs event-driven functions, Lightsail simplifies small deployments, and Batch manages batch processing jobs.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides cost and usage reports that allow you to analyze your spending patterns?
questions.explanation: AWS Cost and Usage Reports (CUR) deliver the most detailed data about your AWS usage and costs. Cost Explorer visualizes spending trends, Budgets sets alerts, and the Pricing Calculator estimates costs before deployment.

questions.question: Which AWS service can simplify migrating large-scale data from on-premises databases to AWS with minimal downtime?
questions.explanation: AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) helps migrate databases to AWS quickly and securely with minimal downtime. Snowball transfers data physically, DataSync automates online transfers, and S3 Transfer Acceleration speeds up uploads to S3 but not databases.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to automatically provision and manage SSL/TLS certificates for your AWS resources?
questions.explanation: AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) automatically provisions and renews SSL/TLS certificates for AWS resources. KMS manages encryption keys, Secrets Manager stores credentials, and IAM handles identity and access management.

questions.question: Which AWS service can help detect and report potentially compromised AWS accounts or resources?
questions.explanation: Amazon GuardDuty continuously monitors AWS accounts and workloads for malicious activity and unauthorized access, helping detect potential security compromises. CloudTrail logs API activity, WAF filters web traffic, and Config monitors configurations.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps you organize, govern, and enforce compliance across multiple AWS accounts?
questions.explanation: AWS Control Tower builds on AWS Organizations to help set up and govern a secure, multi-account AWS environment using preconfigured blueprints, guardrails, and best practices. Organizations provides account management, while IAM handles user access.

questions.question: Which AWS service offers managed, petabyte-scale data warehousing?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is a fully managed, petabyte-scale data warehouse service designed for online analytical processing (OLAP). RDS and Aurora are relational databases for transactional workloads, while DynamoDB is a NoSQL database.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows developers to store, version, and manage application source code securely?
questions.explanation: AWS CodeCommit is a fully managed source control service that hosts secure Git-based repositories. CodePipeline automates CI/CD workflows, CodeDeploy handles deployments, and CodeBuild compiles and tests code.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides centralized visibility into the operational health of your AWS resources?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudWatch provides observability by collecting metrics, logs, and events from AWS resources. It enables dashboards, alarms, and automated responses. CloudTrail logs API calls, Config audits configurations, and Trusted Advisor provides best-practice insights.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a marketplace for third-party software and data solutions?
questions.explanation: AWS Marketplace is a curated digital catalog of third-party software, data, and services that run on AWS. The Partner Network connects AWS partners, Service Catalog manages internal product portfolios, and QuickSight provides BI and analytics.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps detect configuration drift and evaluate compliance with internal policies?
questions.explanation: AWS Config continuously records and evaluates the configuration of AWS resources, detecting drift and verifying compliance with policies. CloudTrail logs API activity, CloudFormation provisions infrastructure, and Trusted Advisor offers recommendations but no compliance tracking.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps protect web applications from DDoS attacks?
questions.explanation: AWS Shield provides managed protection against Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks. Shield Standard is included for free, while Shield Advanced offers enhanced detection and response. WAF filters web traffic, GuardDuty detects threats, and Firewall Manager centralizes security policy management.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a scalable and fully managed file storage system that can be shared across multiple EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: Amazon Elastic File System (EFS) provides fully managed, elastic file storage that can be accessed concurrently by multiple EC2 instances. EBS is block storage attached to one instance, S3 is object storage, and Storage Gateway connects on-premises environments to AWS.

questions.question: Which AWS service enables you to inspect and assess the security posture of your EC2 instances automatically?
questions.explanation: Amazon Inspector automatically assesses applications for vulnerabilities and deviations from security best practices on EC2 instances and container images. GuardDuty detects threats, Trusted Advisor gives general recommendations, and WAF protects web traffic.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides access to compliance reports and agreements such as ISO and SOC certifications?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides self-service access to AWS compliance reports (like SOC and ISO certifications) and customer agreements. Config monitors compliance states, Trusted Advisor gives optimization guidance, and CloudTrail records API activity.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps automate code deployments to EC2 instances and on-premises servers?
questions.explanation: AWS CodeDeploy automates code deployments to EC2 instances, Lambda functions, and on-premises servers, minimizing downtime. CodePipeline orchestrates CI/CD workflows, CodeBuild compiles code, and CodeCommit stores source code repositories.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a managed message broker service compatible with Apache ActiveMQ and RabbitMQ?
questions.explanation: Amazon MQ is a managed message broker service for Apache ActiveMQ and RabbitMQ, simplifying migration from existing message brokers. SNS sends push notifications, SQS provides queuing, and EventBridge handles event-driven integration.

questions.question: Which AWS service lets you visualize and analyze business data using interactive dashboards?
questions.explanation: Amazon QuickSight is AWS’s business intelligence (BI) service that allows users to create and share interactive dashboards and visualizations. Athena queries S3 data, EMR runs big data frameworks, and Glue performs ETL transformations.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides encryption key management and integration with other AWS services for secure data storage?
questions.explanation: AWS Key Management Service (KMS) manages cryptographic keys and integrates with many AWS services to encrypt data at rest and in transit. Secrets Manager stores credentials, Shield defends against DDoS attacks, and Certificate Manager handles SSL/TLS certificates.

questions.question: Which AWS service is used to monitor and record account activity, including API calls made to AWS resources?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail records all API calls and actions made within your AWS account, providing visibility into user and resource activity. CloudWatch monitors performance metrics, Config tracks configurations, and Trusted Advisor provides recommendations.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to forecast cloud spending and usage trends using historical data?
questions.explanation: AWS Cost Explorer enables you to visualize, analyze, and forecast AWS cost and usage over time. Budgets lets you set alerts, the Pricing Calculator estimates costs for future workloads, and Cost and Usage Reports provide raw usage data.
